creator: gregl@datacom.co.nz
text:
A combination of odd features of jar and the ant jar task cause the manifest 
Class-Path entry to be ignored.

When I use jar(jdk1.3.1) to create a jar with a manifest the Class-Path entry 
is ignored unless it is specified before a Name entry.

Ant displays an error message if a Class-Path entry is included before a Name 
entry.

This means it is not possible to add a class-path entry in the manifest! This 
makes it very difficult to write build scripts which bundle libraries in ear 
files.

creator: conor@apache.org
text:
Can you try a few things?

1. Try a recent nightly build. There have been some changes in the Manifest
handling to deal with Class-Path entries.

2. Could you tell us what the error is? Perhaps even a small testcase with a
manifest that causes you problems.
